verses.verse: But I-yov <S%H347><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> <S%H8799><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%>,
Hear <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8798><s%> diligently <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8800><s%> my speech <S%H4405><s%>, and let this be your consolations <S%H8575><s%>.
Suffer <S%H5375><s%> <S%H8798><s%> me that I may speak <S%H1696><s%> <S%H8762><s%>; and after <S%H310><s%> that I have spoken <S%H1696><s%> <S%H8763><s%>, mock on <S%H3932><s%> <S%H8686><s%>.
As for me, is my complaint <S%H7879><s%> to man <S%H120><s%>? and if it were so, why should not my spirit <S%H7307><s%> be troubled <S%H7114><s%> <S%H8799><s%> ?
Mark <S%H6437><s%> <S%H8798><s%> me, and be astonished <S%H8074><s%> <S%H8713><s%>, and lay <S%H7760><s%> <S%H8798><s%> your hand <S%H3027><s%> upon your mouth <S%H6310><s%>.
Havahn when I remember <S%H2142><s%> <S%H8804><s%> I am afraid <S%H926><s%> <S%H8738><s%>, and trembling <S%H6427><s%> taketh hold on <S%H270><s%> <S%H8804><s%> my flesh <S%H1320><s%>.
Wherefore do the wicked <S%H7563><s%> live <S%H2421><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, become old <S%H6275><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, yea, are mighty <S%H1396><s%> <S%H8804><s%> in power <S%H2428><s%> ?
Their seed <S%H2233><s%> is established <S%H3559><s%> <S%H8737><s%> in their sight <S%H6440><s%> with them, and their offspring <S%H6631><s%> before their eyes <S%H5869><s%>.
Their houses <S%H1004><s%> are safe <S%H7965><s%> from fear <S%H6343><s%>, neither is the rod <S%H7626><s%> of 'Elohim <S%H433><s%> upon them.

Their bull <S%H7794><s%> gendereth <S%H5674><s%> <S%H8765><s%>, and faileth <S%H1602><s%> <S%H8686><s%> not; their cow <S%H6510><s%> calveth <S%H6403><s%> <S%H8762><s%>, and casteth not her calf <S%H7921><s%> <S%H8762><s%>.
They send forth <S%H7971><s%> <S%H8762><s%> their little ones <S%H5759><s%> like a flock <S%H6629><s%>, and their children <S%H3206><s%> dance <S%H7540><s%> <S%H8762><s%>.
They take <S%H5375><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the timbrel <S%H8596><s%> and harp <S%H3658><s%>, and rejoice <S%H8055><s%> <S%H8799><s%> at the sound <S%H6963><s%> of the organ <S%H5748><s%>.

They spend <S%H3615><s%> <S%H8762><s%> <S%H8675><s%> <S%H1086><s%> <S%H8762><s%> their days <S%H3117><s%> in wealth <S%H2896><s%>, and in a moment <S%H7281><s%> go down <S%H2865><s%> <S%H8735><s%> <S%H8676><s%> <S%H5181><s%> <S%H8799><s%> to the grave <S%H7585><s%>.

Therefore they say <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%> unto 'Elohim <S%H410><s%>, Depart <S%H5493><s%> <S%H8798><s%> from us; for we desire <S%H2654><s%> <S%H8804><s%> not the knowledge <S%H1847><s%> of thy ways <S%H1870><s%>.
What is 'El SHaddai <S%H7706><s%>, that we should serve <S%H5647><s%> <S%H8799><s%> him? and what profit <S%H3276><s%> <S%H8686><s%> should we have, if we pray <S%H6293><s%> <S%H8799><s%> unto him?
Lo, their good <S%H2898><s%> is not in their hand <S%H3027><s%>: the counsel <S%H6098><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> is far <S%H7368><s%> <S%H8804><s%> from me.

How oft is the candle <S%H5216><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> put out <S%H1846><s%> <S%H8799><s%> ! and how oft cometh <S%H935><s%> <S%H8799><s%> their destruction <S%H343><s%> upon them! 'Elohim distributeth <S%H2505><s%> <S%H8762><s%> sorrows <S%H2256><s%> in his anger <S%H639><s%>.
They are as stubble <S%H8401><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%>, and as chaff <S%H4671><s%> that the storm <S%H5492><s%> carrieth away <S%H1589><s%> <S%H8804><s%>.

'Elohim <S%H433><s%> layeth up <S%H6845><s%> <S%H8799><s%> his iniquity <S%H205><s%> for his children <S%H1121><s%>: he rewardeth <S%H7999><s%> <S%H8762><s%> him, and he shall know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8799><s%> it.
His eyes <S%H5869><s%> shall see <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8799><s%> his destruction <S%H3589><s%>, and he shall drink <S%H8354><s%> <S%H8799><s%> of the wrath <S%H2534><s%> of 'El SHaddai <S%H7706><s%>.

For what pleasure <S%H2656><s%> hath he in his house <S%H1004><s%> after <S%H310><s%> him, when the number <S%H4557><s%> of his months <S%H2320><s%> is cut off in the midst <S%H2686><s%> <S%H8795><s%> ?
Shall any teach <S%H3925><s%> <S%H8762><s%> 'Elohim <S%H410><s%> knowledge <S%H1847><s%>? seeing he judgeth <S%H8199><s%> <S%H8799><s%> those that are high <S%H7311><s%> <S%H8802><s%>.
One dieth <S%H4191><s%> <S%H8799><s%> in his full <S%H8537><s%> strength <S%H6106><s%>, being wholly at ease <S%H7946><s%> and quiet <S%H7961><s%>.
His breasts <S%H5845><s%> are full <S%H4390><s%> <S%H8804><s%> of milk <S%H2461><s%>, and his bones <S%H6106><s%> are moistened <S%H8248><s%> <S%H8792><s%> with marrow <S%H4221><s%>.
And another dieth <S%H4191><s%> <S%H8799><s%> in the bitterness <S%H4751><s%> of his soul <S%H5315><s%>, and never eateth <S%H398><s%> <S%H8804><s%> with pleasure <S%H2896><s%>.
They shall lie down <S%H7901><s%> <S%H8799><s%> alike <S%H3162><s%> in the dust <S%H6083><s%>, and the worms <S%H7415><s%> shall cover <S%H3680><s%> <S%H8762><s%> them.
Behold, I know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8804><s%> your thoughts <S%H4284><s%>, and the devices <S%H4209><s%> which ye wrongfully imagine <S%H2554><s%> <S%H8799><s%> against me.
For ye say <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, Where is the house <S%H1004><s%> of the prince <S%H5081><s%>? and where are the dwelling <S%H4908><s%> places <S%H168><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> ?
Have ye not asked <S%H7592><s%> <S%H8804><s%> them that go <S%H5674><s%> <S%H8802><s%> by the way <S%H1870><s%>? and do ye not know <S%H5234><s%> <S%H8762><s%> their tokens <S%H226><s%>,

That the wicked <S%H7451><s%> is reserved <S%H2820><s%> <S%H8735><s%> to the day <S%H3117><s%> of destruction <S%H343><s%>? they shall be brought forth <S%H2986><s%> <S%H8714><s%> to the day <S%H3117><s%> of wrath <S%H5678><s%>.
Who shall declare <S%H5046><s%> <S%H8686><s%> his way <S%H1870><s%> to his face <S%H6440><s%>? and who shall repay <S%H7999><s%> <S%H8762><s%> him what he hath done <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8804><s%> ?
Yet shall he be brought <S%H2986><s%> <S%H8714><s%> to the grave <S%H6913><s%>, and shall remain <S%H8245><s%> <S%H8799><s%> in the tomb <S%H1430><s%>.

The clods <S%H7263><s%> of the valley <S%H5158><s%> shall be sweet <S%H4985><s%> <S%H8804><s%> unto him, and every man <S%H120><s%> shall draw <S%H4900><s%> <S%H8799><s%> after <S%H310><s%> him, as there are innumerable <S%H4557><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him.
How then comfort <S%H5162><s%> <S%H8762><s%> ye me in vain <S%H1892><s%>, seeing in your answers <S%H8666><s%> there remaineth <S%H7604><s%> <S%H8738><s%> falsehood <S%H4604><s%> ?
